SHA1 (RFC 3174) was cryptographically broken. It's still used. Don't use it for a new protocol. Initial state

 
const SHA1_IV = /* @__PURE__ */ new Uint32Array([
    0x67452301, 0xefcdab89, 0x98badcfe, 0x10325476, 0xc3d2e1f0,
]);

Temporary buffer, not used to store anything between runs Named this way because it matches specification.
